title: Infinium Wins Energy Transition Technology of the Year at S&P Global Commodity Insights' 25th Annual Platts Global ... - PR Newswire
summary: Infinium, a company specializing in electrofuels, was named Energy Transition Technology of the Year at the Platts Global Energy Awards. Infinium's electrofuels are produced using carbon dioxide and renewable hydrogen, resulting in ultra-low carbon fuels that are cleaner burning than traditional petroleum-based fuels. The company's innovative technology aims to accelerate the market's progress toward achieving climate goals during the energy transition.

title: Solar PV key to transforming water, energy, food crises into a nexus opportunity - pv magazine International
summary: The article advocates for an integrated approach to energy, water, and food systems in Africa, emphasizing the potential of solar energy to drive sustainable development.  It highlights two specific green technologies: solar desalination, which offers a carbon-free and cost-effective solution for water scarcity, and agrivoltaics, which combines solar power generation with agriculture to address food security and water stress.  RES4Africa, a non-profit focused on renewable energy in Africa, calls for political commitment and policy support to accelerate the adoption of these innovations.
likely_naics_codes: ['221112 - Electric Power Generation, Transmission, and Distribution', '333914 - Solar Energy Equipment Manufacturing', '423820 - Water, Sewer, and Waste Management', '111110 - Crop Production']
greenwashing: The article promotes technologies and practices that are genuinely designed to reduce environmental impact, not engage in deceptive marketing or misleading claims, indicating it does not present greenwashing.

title: TS Conductor Wins Rising Star Company at S&P Global Commodity Insights' 25th Annual Platts Global Energy Awards - PR Web
summary: TS Conductor, a company specializing in advanced electrical conductors, has developed a high-performance, high-strength conductor that can transport three times the electricity with half the line losses and minimal sag compared to conventional conductors. This innovation is being recognized for its contribution to a cleaner energy future, as it enables increased connectivity for renewable generation and helps utilities upgrade their infrastructure without extensive tower replacements.
